Definition: You will be given a negotiation between two participants. You are to output 'Yes' if both participants agree to the deal, and 'No' if they do not agree to the deal.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.input: THEM: i need the hats and the ball  YOU: i can give you one hat and the ball. i want 2 books and 1 hat  THEM: i have to have both hats and the ball or both hats and a book to make a deal  YOU: sorry, i won`t make a deal without a hat  THEM: if you take 1 hat i have to have everything else  YOU: sorry can`t do  THEM: no deal  YOU: yesh no deal, sorry  THEM: no deal  YOU: no deal.
Positive Examples.explanation: Both participants do not agree to the deal, so the answer is No.

Positive Examples.input: THEM: hi i would like the book and ball and you can have the hats  YOU: i can give you either the book or the ball  THEM: ill take the book  YOU: ok i will take the hats and ball  THEM: deal.
Positive Examples.explanation: Both participants agree to the deal, so the answer is Yes.

Negative Examples.input: THEM: lemme get that book and ball!  YOU: i need 2 balls and a hat  THEM: i'll take the book and two hats then?  YOU: ok.
Negative Examples.explanation: Both participants agree to the deal, so the correct answer is Yes.

Negative Examples.input: THEM: hello. i would like the book and one ball.  YOU: you can have one ball 1 hat  THEM: i need the book or it's no deal.  YOU: no deal i am keeping the book  THEM: ok no deal  YOU: okay sounds good  THEM: alright  YOU: okay  THEM: alright no deal  YOU: okay its no deal.
Negative Examples.explanation: Both participants do not agree to the deal, so the correct answer is No.

Instances.input: THEM: i would like 3 balls and the hat and book  YOU: well, since this hit calls for us to negotiate an agreement. i'd like to find an offer that works for the both of us instead of giving you every item. you can definitely have the book, what else would you like to offer?  THEM: that was my opener so i expect counter offers of course, i don't really want the book and would much prefer the balls over anything else.  YOU: book has no value to me at all, i assume it'll give you minimal points. i'd be ok with two balls and the hat?  THEM: anyway i can get 3 balls?  YOU: that wouldn't allow me any points. i need to settle at 3 balls, or two balls and the hat ; can we make one of them work?  THEM: i guess we can do 2 balls for me and the book. you get 2 balls and the hat  YOU: i assume that's fair. deal.
THEM: i would like the ball and the book. you can have all the hats.  YOU: i can agree to that  THEM: great! have a great night!

THEM: if i can have the ball and the books you can have the hats  YOU: i really need the ball.  THEM: if you take the ball then i would need everything else  YOU: how about i get the ball and one hat then?  THEM: no deal. the ball is worth too much to me to accept you taking anything but it.  YOU: ok, i agree to your previous offer then.  THEM: okay thank you.
THEM: give me book and hat  YOU: ok.

THEM: hi. ill take the balls and books and you can have the hat  YOU: gee.... what a deal =p i'll take two books and a hat  THEM: no sorry. how about 2 balls and the hat?  YOU: still screws me mathmatically....... i can go two books and two balls or the hat and two books...... or all three books  THEM: sorry looks like we dont have a deal  YOU: ok.... click on the no deal button when you can  THEM: ok. we have to go back and forth until it does  YOU: ok  THEM: yep  YOU: ok.

THEM: i need the hat and books, you can have the balls  YOU: i don't feel like that's agreeable. the books are the most valuable to my collection.  THEM: then you keep the books and i get the hat and the balls.

THEM: i would like the ball and book. you can have the 3 hats.  YOU: i'd prefer just the book and you can have everything else  THEM: no, sorry. i really need the book.  YOU: yeah, i do too. it's literally the only thing of value on my side  THEM: i suppose it'll be a no deal then.  YOU: for the sake of us not both getting screwed you can take the book and i'll take the rest  THEM: no i really need the book and ball.  YOU: sure, pay it forward. deal  THEM: thanks.
THEM: i need both balls and the book  YOU: well thats what i need too  THEM: you keep the book and i take the rest  YOU: that will not work for me, i will take 1 ball and 2 hats  THEM: agreed.
